gallery.gallery_title: Andrea Bruce Explains Her Approach to Romania Sex Trafficking Story

gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: In a small village a few hours from Bucharest is one of the few shelters for trafficked teenage girls in Romania. Two sisters at the shelter tattooed the names of family members on their bodies “to keep them close,” one said.

Viola Tudor, a convicted human trafficker, sits in the visiting room of the prison where he served his sentence. Not shy about his role in trafficking, he claimed that he helped the girls he sold, and bragged about the profits he made.

In Bacâu County, an Orthodox church holds services in a community almost absent of young women. An air of shame and a culture of privacy prevents most communities from confronting the traffickers who lure away so many girls.
Seen here, photographer Andrea Bruce who sought out sex traffickers and their victims on the streets of Bucharest, in rural villages, at prisons, shelters and other locations.
